Rule.Name: Ensure SELinux Is Enabled in Enforcing Mode (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: SELinux is not enabled in enforcing mode.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Enable SELinux in enforcing mode by setting SELINUX=enforcing in /etc/selinux/config and running setenforce 1.

Rule.Name: Ensure Apache Processes Run in the httpd_t Confined Context (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: Apache processes are not running in the httpd_t SELinux context.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Restore the default SELinux context for Apache binaries.
Rule.Verification: ps -eZ | grep httpd | grep -q "httpd_t" && echo 0 || echo 1

Rule.Name: Ensure the httpd_t Type is Not in Permissive Mode (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: The SELinux domain httpd_t is in permissive mode.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Remove httpd_t from the permissive list.

Rule.Name: Ensure Only the Necessary SELinux Booleans are Enabled (Manual)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: Unnecessary SELinux booleans for Apache are enabled.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Review and disable unnecessary SELinux booleans for Apache.
Rule.Correction: Manual review required; use setsebool -P to adjust SELinux booleans as per policy
